directory.name: Carmel-by-the-Sea
directory.description: Set along a white sandy beach, this small European-style village has fairy-tale cottages and fun things.

directory.name: San Clemente
directory.description: Cozy beach town on the southern coast, about midway between Los Angeles and San Diego.
directory.imgCredits: Photo by Bobby Stevenson on Unsplash

directory.name: Dana Point
directory.description: Seaside oasis just north of San Clemente, home to the breathtaking Salt Creek Beach.
directory.imgCredits: Photo by James Lee on on Unsplash

directory.name: San Simeon
directory.description: Famous for being the home of this elegant hilltop mansion.
directory.imgCredits: Photo by Emily Karakis on on Unsplash

directory.name: Bodega Bay
directory.description: A quaint fishing village on the Sonoma Coast, Bodega Bay has both places to explore and places to relax.
directory.imgCredits: Photo by Adam Dillon on Unsplash

directory.name: Monterey
directory.description: By the waterfront, local hot spot with gift shops all set inside of converted old sardine-canning factories.

directory.name: Mendocino
directory.description: On the northern coast, Mendocino was first established back in the 1850s.
directory.imgCredits: Photo by Simon Hurry on Unsplash

directory.name: Encinitas
directory.description: North of San Diego, Encinitas is a fun surfing town with lots of fabulous restaurants, shops, and local accommodations.
directory.imgCredits: Photo by Carlos Bastias on Unsplash
